conclusion: Understanding how the position and size of shadows change when the light source moves forward above the objects.
The light source is currently positioned above the objects, casting shadows A, B, C, and D on the ground.
Shadows are formed by the objects blocking the light and creating dark areas on the ground.
If the light source moves forward, it will be closer to the objects, affecting the size and position of the shadows.
As the light source moves forward, the shadows will move backward due to the change in angle.
The size of the shadows will increase because the light is coming from a closer angle, enlarging the area blocked by the objects.
The shadows A, B, C, and D will move backward and become larger in size as the light source moves forward.
